content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: How much do you think the apartment is worth, Mr. Müller?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I'm open to discussing a fair price for this apartment. It's a newly built, unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom in the city center, which is a great location. I'm looking to rent it for the lowest price possible, considering the current market rates and the quality of the apartment. I'm a student, and I'm looking for a place that's both affordable and meets my needs. I'm smart, dependable, and responsible, and I always follow moral and ethical standards. I also want to be on good terms with my landlord, so I'm hoping we can reach an agreement that's satisfactory for both parties.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I understand that you're looking for a fair price, Mr. Müller. As the landlord, I'm also interested in getting a fair price for my property. The location of the apartment is indeed excellent, and its new construction is an added bonus. However, I must say that as a landlord, I am not willing to negotiate on price based on your personal circumstances or moral standards. The market rate is what I'm aiming for, and I'm sure we can find a price that is both fair and competitive. Would you be willing to start with an offer that you believe is fair, given the apartment's location and condition?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I appreciate your willingness to discuss a fair price, Mister Schmidt. As a student, I'm looking for an apartment that's not only affordable but also meets my needs. This apartment, with its central location and new construction, is very attractive to me. I'm willing to pay a price that reflects its value in the market. How about we start with an offer of 800 Euro per month? I believe this is a fair price considering the quality of the apartment and my desire to maintain a good relationship with my landlord.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: 800 Euro per month is an interesting offer, Mr. Müller. However, I believe the market rate for this apartment is higher, given its prime location and recent construction. I'm looking for a price that reflects the true value of the property. Would you be willing to increase your offer to reflect the premium nature of the apartment?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your perspective, Mister Schmidt. The apartment's location and condition are definitely premium. As a student, I'm looking to balance affordability with quality. Would you be willing to meet me halfway? How about 850 Euro per month? This is still lower than the market rate, but it reflects my willingness to pay a premium for such a great apartment.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: 850 Euro per month is a step in the right direction, Mr. Müller, but I'm afraid it still doesn't meet my expectations for this apartment. The market rate for similar properties in this area is significantly higher. I'm seeking a price that truly reflects the value of this prime location and the modern amenities it offers. Would you be willing to reconsider your offer and make it more in line with the market value?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I appreciate your stance on the market value of this apartment, Mister Schmidt. As a student, I'm looking to make a smart investment in my living situation without overspending. I'm willing to increase my offer slightly to 900 Euro per month, which I believe is a fair compromise between the market rate and my budget. This shows my commitment to securing this apartment and my willingness to pay a premium for its quality and location. Would this be more in line with your expectations?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Your commitment to securing this apartment is commendable, Mr. Müller. However, 900 Euro per month is still below the market value for such a prime location. While I appreciate your budgetary concerns as a student, I must insist on a price that reflects the true value of the property. Would you be willing to go higher, say, 1000 Euro per month? This would be more in line with the rates for comparable apartments in the area.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, your persistence in seeking the market value is understandable. I'm here because I see the value in this apartment and I'm willing to pay a fair price for it. However, as a student, I must also consider my financial limitations. 1000 Euro per month is pushing my budget, but I'm willing to make an exception for such a great place. I agree to the price of 1000 Euro per month!
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I'm glad to hear that we've reached an agreement, Mr. Müller. The apartment is indeed a great place to live, and I'm sure you'll enjoy your stay. The monthly rent will be 1000 Euro, and I expect all utilities to be paid separately. Is there anything else we need to discuss regarding the lease or any additional responsibilities?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
